001package net.tvburger.jdl.linalg;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.numbers.JavaNumberTypeSupport;
004
005public final class Matrices {
006
007    private Matrices() {
008    }
009
010    public static <N extends Number> TypedMatrix<N> create(N[][] values, JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> typeSupport) {
011        return new TypedMatrix<>(values, typeSupport);
012    }
013
014    public static TypedMatrix<Double> of(double[]... rows) {
015        Double[][] values = new Double[rows.length][];
016        int length = -1;
017        for (int i = 0; i < rows.length; i++) {
018            double[] row = rows[i];
019            if (length < 0) {
020                length = row.length;
021            } else if (length != row.length) {
022                throw new IllegalArgumentException();
023            }
024            values[i] = new Double[length];
025            for (int j = 0; j < length; j++) {
026                values[i][j] = row[j];
027            }
028        }
029        return new TypedMatrix<>(values, JavaNumberTypeSupport.DOUBLE);
030    }
031
032    public static TypedMatrix<Float> of(float[]... rows) {
033        Float[][] values = new Float[rows.length][];
034        int length = -1;
035        for (int i = 0; i < rows.length; i++) {
036            float[] row = rows[i];
037            if (length < 0) {
038                length = row.length;
039            } else if (length != row.length) {
040                throw new IllegalArgumentException();
041            }
042            values[i] = new Float[length];
043            for (int j = 0; j < length; j++) {
044                values[i][j] = row[j];
045            }
046        }
047        return new TypedMatrix<>(values, JavaNumberTypeSupport.FLOAT);
048    }
049
050    public static <N extends Number> TypedMatrix<N> identity(int n, JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> support) {
051        N[][] values = support.createArrayOfArrays(n, n);
052        for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
053            values[i][i] = support.one();
054        }
055        return new TypedMatrix<>(values, support);
056    }
057
058    public static <N extends Number> boolean isIdentity(TypedMatrix<N> matrix) {
059        return isIdentity(matrix, matrix.getCurrentNumberType());
060    }
061
062    public static <N extends Number> boolean isIdentity(Matrix<N> matrix, JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> support) {
063        if (matrix.m() != matrix.n()) {
064            return false;
065        }
066        for (int i = 1; i <= matrix.m(); i++) {
067            for (int j = 1; j <= matrix.n(); j++) {
068                if (i == j && !support.isOne(matrix.get(i, j)) || i != j && !support.isZero(matrix.get(i, j))) {
069                    return false;
070                }
071            }
072        }
073        return true;
074    }
075
076    public static <N extends Number, M extends Number> Matrix<M> convert(Matrix<N> matrix, JavaNumberTypeSupport<M> typeSupport) {
077        M[][] numbers = typeSupport.createArrayOfArrays(matrix.m(), matrix.n());
078        for (int i = 0; i < matrix.m(); i++) {
079            for (int j = 0; j < matrix.n(); j++) {
080                numbers[i][j] = typeSupport.valueOf(matrix.get(i + 1, j + 1).doubleValue());
081            }
082        }
083        return new TypedMatrix<>(numbers, typeSupport);
084    }
085
086    public static Matrix<Double> withDoublePrecision(Matrix<Float> matrix) {
087        Double[][] doubles = JavaNumberTypeSupport.DOUBLE.createArrayOfArrays(matrix.m(), matrix.n());
088        for (int i = 0; i < matrix.m(); i++) {
089            for (int j = 0; j < matrix.n(); j++) {
090                doubles[i][j] = (double) matrix.get(i + 1, j + 1);
091            }
092        }
093        return new TypedMatrix<>(doubles, JavaNumberTypeSupport.DOUBLE);
094    }
095
096    public static Matrix<Float> withSinglePrecision(Matrix<Double> matrix) {
097        Float[][] floats = JavaNumberTypeSupport.FLOAT.createArrayOfArrays(matrix.m(), matrix.n());
098        for (int i = 0; i < matrix.m(); i++) {
099            for (int j = 0; j < matrix.n(); j++) {
100                floats[i][j] = (float) (double) matrix.get(i + 1, j + 1);
101            }
102        }
103        return new TypedMatrix<>(floats, JavaNumberTypeSupport.FLOAT);
104    }
105}
